content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Sure, here is an example of how you might write this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks using regex 
    code_blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=1))

    if length(code_blocks) == 0
        return ""
    end

    # Extract the code from each block and remove surrounding whitespace
    codes = map(x -> strip(String(x.captures[1])), code_blocks)

    # Join all the codes together with a newline in between
    return join(codes, "\n")
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find and extract the Julia code blocks from the input markdown document string. It then strips any whitespace from the beginning or end of each code block before joining them together into one string. Note that this approach assumes that the code fences are correctly formatted as "````julia\n" at the start, and "\n```" at the end.
